channel.title: Compile errors!
channel.description:
Hey, When i go to Compile the server it gives me this error in the black box. "You must have JDK 5 or 6 to be able to use this command".
I have JDK 1.6.0.20
So.. do i need to set paths or classpaths more or something.. because i can RUN the server.. because users are on it playing right now. So why cant i compile.
Also, when i add npc's in the game i type "::npc 9" etc. What do i type when i would like to add objects eg "::object (object number)??
Thanks.

item.title: Compile errors!
item.dc:creator: @MobilScape MobilScape
item.description:
@MobilScape wrote:

Ok, I did that, and this is the error… I am a begginner so in alot of detail, how do i fix this??

Read full topic

item.title: Compile errors!
item.dc:creator: @MobilScape MobilScape
item.description:
@MobilScape wrote:

But, where do i put that code you gave me…
DO i replace it with all the stuff thats in my compiler txt doc?

Read full topic

item.title: Compile errors!
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

You add the command under void customCommands
::object adds the defined object on your current coords
You check your classpath with this batch code

@echo off
Javac *.java
pause

Read full topic

item.title: Compile errors!
item.dc:creator: @MobilScape MobilScape
item.description:
@MobilScape wrote:

where do i add that command??

I want it soo like i can put the codes i found on runelocus there… so like ::object 590. <adds a bank table.

Also, I have set my classpaths… How do i check if it worked?

Read full topic

item.title: Compile errors!
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

You need to set your path and classpath, or you can edit the batch code.

For a ::object command you can use this.

if (command.startsWith("object")) { int object = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7)); makeGlobalObject(absX, absY, object, 0, 10); }

Read full topic
